solution.text:
let the equation be of the form \(ax^3+bx^2+cx+d\)
we have been given \( \alpha + \beta +\gamma = _{{j+k+l}}_=\frac {-b}a\) , \(\alpha\beta + \beta\gamma + \gamma\alpha = _{{j*k+k*l+l*j}}_=\frac ca\) and \(\alpha\times \beta\times \gamma=_{{j*k*l}}_=\frac {-d}a\)
Now if we take a=1, we can get a solution b=_{{-(j+k+l)}}_ , c=_{{j*k+k*l+l*j}}_ and d=_{{-(j*k*l)}}_
therefore the equation becomes \(x^3-_{{j+k+l}}_x^2+_{{j*k+k*l+l*j}}_x-_{{j*k*l}}_\)

Find the cubic equation if sum of the zeros of a cubic equation _{{j+k+l}}_,
product of the zeros taken two at a times is _{{j*k+k*l+l*j}}_ and product of the 3 roots is _{{j*k*l}}_
